info.name: feed-backend
info.description: Postman collection covering feed-backend REST APIs.

request.description: Fetch sidebar entries with pagination and optional filters for disp_name and screen_name.
Retrieve a single sidebar entry by id.
Create a sidebar entry. Requires authentication.
Update display metadata, icon, or status for a sidebar entry. Requires authentication.
Soft delete (status=0) a sidebar entry. Requires authentication.
Returns conditional list items visible to the logged-in user. Items with empty permissions are public; otherwise any matching permission grants visibility.
Fetch conditional list items with pagination and optional filters.
Retrieve a single conditional list item by id.
Create a conditional list item. Requires authentication.
Update a conditional list item. Requires authentication.
Soft delete (status=0) a conditional list item. Requires authentication.

Generates a one-time password for the provided contact number and returns it in the response for testing. The response includes the remaining attemptsLeft; calling again before the OTP expires decrements attemptsLeft until it reaches zero.

Verifies the OTP (or the master OTP) for the supplied mobile number. If the contact number has not been seen before, a new user is provisioned automatically. Returns the JWT, the user profile + access details, and a userExists flag to indicate whether the user pre-existed.
Retrieves the authenticated user's profile information including user details, profile data, roles, and permissions. Requires a valid Bearer token obtained from the Login endpoint.

body.raw:
{
  "email": "demo@example1.com",
  "fullName": "Demo User",
  "profile": {

    "status": 1

}

request.description: Updates the authenticated user's editable fields across User and UserProfile models (contact number and administrative flags remain read-only). Requires a valid Bearer token obtained from the Login endpoint.
Uploads a new avatar for the authenticated user. Submit a single profileImage file (JPEG/PNG/WEBP/HEIC). The response returns the updated user record.
Returns the permission groups and their accessible permissions for the authenticated user. Users with the wildcard (*) grant receive all groups. (Legacy sidebar access)

query.description: Search by contact number, full name, or email
Column to sort by: id, contactNumber, fullName, email, createdAt
Filter by a specific user id
Filter users whose email contains the supplied value
Filter users whose full name contains the supplied value
Filter by status (comma-separated to match multiple statuses; e.g., 1,2)
Inclusive lower bound for profile date of birth (YYYY-MM-DD)
Inclusive upper bound for profile date of birth (YYYY-MM-DD)
Filter profiles whose occupation contains the supplied value
Filter profiles whose city contains the supplied value
Filter profiles whose state contains the supplied value
Filter profiles whose postalCode contains the supplied value
Filter profiles whose referredBy contains the supplied value
Filter by educational detail group id
Inclusive lower bound for date of joining (YYYY-MM-DD)
Inclusive upper bound for date of joining (YYYY-MM-DD)

request.description: Returns a paginated list of users with their profiles, roles, permissions, and access profiles. Supports fuzzy search plus granular filters for user fields (contactNumber, id, email, fullName, status) and profile fields including dateOfBirth/dateOfJoining ranges, citizenAge range, genderId, maritalStatusId, occupation, city/state/postalCode, wardNumberId/boothNumberId/sectorId, postsBlocked, referredBy, and educational detail ids.
Retrieves detailed information for a specific user by ID, including their profile, roles, permissions, and access profiles (ward, booth, MLA constituency).

query.description: Optional: filter posts containing the tag substring.
Optional: search term applied to the post description.
Optional: page size up to 100 (defaults to 20).
Optional: sort direction for creation date (ASC or DESC, defaults to DESC).

request.description: Lists active posts with optional tag and location filters. Pass `sort=ASC` for oldest-first; default is `DESC`. Reaction counts and active media entries are embedded in each record.
Retrieves a single active post by id including media, author, and aggregated reaction counts.

exec: pm.test("Like entry has likedAt and user", function () {

query.description: Optional: page size up to 100 (defaults to 20).
Optional: sort direction for liked time (ASC or DESC, defaults to DESC).

request.description: Lists users who liked the post with their full name, profile image, and liked time.

query.description: Optional: page size up to 100 (defaults to 20).

request.description: Lists only the authenticated creator's active posts with pagination.

Creates a new post for the authenticated user. Submit the request as multipart/form-data with optional `media` files (JPEG/PNG/WEBP/HEIC images or MP4 videos, max 4 images + 1 video at 5MB each). Uploaded media becomes available from `{{baseUrl}}/uploads/...`.
Updates a post's textual metadata (description, tags, and coordinates). Only the original creator or an admin can modify it. To manage media, use the dedicated media endpoints.
Appends additional media to an existing post. Provide uploads via `media` file fields while respecting the 4 image / 1 video limit.
Soft deletes one or more media items from a post by marking them inactive. Pass the media IDs to remove.
Soft deletes a post. Only the creator or an admin may perform this action.
Adds or updates the caller's reaction for the post. Use LIKE or DISLIKE to react, or NO_REACTION to clear an existing reaction. Returns the updated reaction counts.

query.description: Optional: search term applied to title or description.
Optional: page size up to 100 (defaults to 20).
Optional: sort direction for start date/time (ASC or DESC, defaults to ASC).

request.description: Lists active events with pagination and optional filters for title, place, or date range. Set `sort=DESC` for the latest events first (default is `ASC`).
Retrieves a single active event along with its media and registration count.

formdata.value: Neighborhood volunteers gather for a cleanup.

request.description: Creates a new event for the authenticated user. Submit as multipart/form-data with optional `media` files (JPEG/PNG/WEBP/HEIC images or MP4 videos, max 4 photos + 1 video at 5MB each). Text-only submissions still work if media is omitted.
Updates event details. Media updates must be handled using the dedicated media endpoints.
Uploads additional media for an existing event (max 4 images + 1 video in total, each ≤ 5MB). Update the file path before sending.

exec: var exists = jsonData.media.some(function (item) { return item && item.id === removedId; });
pm.expect(exists, "Removed media should not be present").to.be.false;

request.description: Soft-deletes one or more media items from an event. Provide mediaIds from the add media response.
Soft deletes an event and its media/registrations.
Registers a user for the event. Requires fullName and contactNumber (mandatory). userId, email, designationId (MetaDesignation id), and other fields are optional.
Registers a guest (non-user) for an event. Requires fullName and contactNumber (mandatory). Do not send userId for guest registration. designationId (MetaDesignation id) is optional.
Registers a guest with only mandatory fields: fullName and contactNumber.
Soft-unregisters the authenticated user from the event. Optionally include a reason.
Unregisters a specific registration by ID. Can unregister your own user registration or a guest registration you created. Reason is optional.

exec: pm.test("Registration has registeredAt and isGuest flag", function () {
pm.test("User registration has user details", function () {

query.description: Optional: set to true to include inactive (status 0) registrations.
Optional page size up to 100 (defaults to 20).
Optional: field to sort by (defaults to registeredAt).
Optional: sort direction ASC or DESC (defaults to DESC).

request.description: Lists registrations for a specific event, including both user and guest registrations. Each registration includes all registration columns (including designationId), plus designation (id, dispName), isGuest and registeredAt. User registrations have user details, guest registrations have guestDetails. Use includeUnregistered=true to include soft-unregistered entries. Use sortBy=registeredAt and sort=ASC|DSC to control ordering.

Uploads an Excel sheet and creates/updates registrations in bulk. Required columns: fullName, contactNumber. Optional: userId, email, registeredBy, fullAddress, wardNumberId, boothNumberId, designationId, dateOfBirth (YYYY-MM-DD), age. File is discarded after processing.

exec: pm.test("Response success flag is true", function () {

query.description: Optional: filter by status (0 inactive, 1 active, omit or all for both).
Optional: filter by submission type (self or others).
Optional: sort direction for created date (`ASC` or `DESC`, default `DESC`).
Optional: page size up to 100 (defaults to 20).

request.description: Lists job applications with pagination, optional status/submission filters, and customizable sort order. Responses include applicant profile details when available.

exec: pm.test("Response success flag is true", function () {

request.description: Retrieves a single active job application with applicant details if available.

exec: pm.test("Response success flag is true", function () {

request.description: Creates a new job application. When applying for others, include contact and address details plus the resume file (PDF, DOC, DOCX up to 25 MB).

exec: pm.test("Response success flag is true", function () {

request.description: Updates an existing job application. Submit the same required fields; include a resume file to replace the previous upload.
Soft deletes a job application by setting status to 0.

Registers a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) device token for the authenticated user. Required for receiving push notifications. The `token` is mandatory, while `deviceId` and `platform` are optional. Platform must be one of: ios, android, or web.
Unregisters (deactivates) a device token for the authenticated user. The device will no longer receive push notifications.
Retrieves all device tokens registered for the authenticated user.
Sends a push notification to a specific user. The notification will be sent to all active devices registered by that user.
Sends a push notification to all users with active device tokens. This is typically used for system-wide announcements or important updates.
Subscribes one or more device tokens to a topic. Topics allow sending notifications to multiple devices without storing individual tokens.
Unsubscribes one or more device tokens from a topic.
Sends a push notification to all devices subscribed to a specific topic.
Get detailed delivery status for all recipients of a specific notification log. Returns notification details, summary statistics, and list of all recipients with their delivery status.

query.description: User ID to check notification delivery status for

request.description: Get delivery status for a specific user for a notification. Returns user's delivery status, error message (if failed), and FCM response.

query.description: Optional: Start date for filtering notifications (ISO format)
Optional: End date for filtering notifications (ISO format)
Optional: Filter by notification type (e.g., event_created, broadcast)
Optional: Filter by delivery status (pending, success, failed)

request.description: Get aggregate delivery statistics with optional filters. Returns overall summary and per-notification breakdown with success rates.

query.description: Optional: Number of records per page (default: 50)
Optional: Number of records to skip for pagination (default: 0)

request.description: Get all failed notifications for a specific user. Returns paginated list of failed notifications with error details and associated notification information.

exec: pm.test("Response success flag is true", function () {

query.description: Optional: filter by status (0 inactive, 1 active, omit or all for both).
Optional: fuzzy search across scheme name and description.
Optional: sort field (createdAt, updatedAt, schemeName, status).
Optional: page size up to 100 (defaults to 20).

request.description: Updates user information including profile, roles, accessibility profiles, and approval status (0=inactive, 1=approved/active, 2=pending approval). All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.
Detaches the specified role from the user. If all roles are removed, the default public role is restored automatically.
Blocks or unblocks a user's ability to create posts. Set action to "block" or "unblock".

query.description: Column to sort by: id, dispName, createdAt

request.description: Get a specific role with its permissions, parent role, and child roles.
Get only the permissions for a specific role, including permission group details.
Creates a role with the supplied numeric permission IDs. Call the permissions listing endpoint to look up IDs.

query.description: Column to sort by: id, permissionKey, dispName, createdAt

request.description: Lists every permission record (including wildcards such as posts:*). Requires the admin.permissions:list grant.

request.description: List meta table data with pagination/search/status filters. Use appendOther=1 (or append_other=1) to append an "Other" entry with id -1 at the end. Use need_all=1 to include -ALL- at the beginning.
Get all meta table registry entries with pagination and search
Get a single registry entry by ID
Create a new meta table registry entry. Cache is automatically invalidated.
Update an existing registry entry. Cache is automatically invalidated.
Soft delete a registry entry (sets status to 0). Cache is automatically invalidated.
Manually reload the registry cache. Useful after direct database changes.
Get statistics about registry entries (total, active, inactive counts)
Returns paginated forms along with their fields, options, and any ward/booth mappings attached to each form. Requires authentication so the backend can determine the caller's ward/booth mapping.

body.raw:
{
  "title": "Ward Engagement Survey",
  "description": "Collect feedback from ward residents",

request.description: Creates a form. Provide optional `wardNumberId` and/or `boothNumberId` to automatically create a tbl_form_mapping record. Omit those fields or send them as null to leave the form unmapped. Set `includeWardAndBooth` to true to prepend ward/booth select fields to the form. Form fields can set `metaTable` to a meta table `tableName` to auto-populate options.

query.description: Filter by active (1) or inactive (0) events.
Optional: only events that use a specific form template.
Optional: events starting on/after this date.
Optional: events starting on/before this date.

request.description: Returns paginated form events with their accessibility matrix (ward, booth, and user role combinations) and the linked form template.
Retrieves a single form event along with its accessibility definitions. Set `formEventId` using the list call.

Creates a form event for a specific form template and seeds one or more accessibility entries. All accessibility rows are created together so each event can target the right ward, booth, and role combination.
Updates event metadata and replaces the accessibility matrix. Provide the complete accessibility array whenever you change ward/booth/role assignments.
Soft deletes a form event (status set to 0) and marks its accessibility rows inactive. Existing submissions remain untouched.

formdata.description: File upload for fieldId 173. Use file type. For empty value, leave disabled.

request.description: Submit a form using multipart form-data. Each field is sent as a form-data key matching the formFieldId. Text values are sent as text. File fields are sent as file parts using the same formFieldId as the key; repeat the key for multiple files (max 5 per field). For multi-select text fields, repeat the same key or send CSV; repeated keys are joined as CSV.
Retrieve a specific form submission with all field values and metadata. User can view their own submissions; admins can view all. Option fields include `resolved` in each fieldValue.
List all submissions for a specific form event with pagination, filtering, and sorting. Option fields include `resolved` in each fieldValue.
List authenticated user's own form submissions with pagination and sorting. Option fields include `resolved` in each fieldValue.
Get submission statistics for a form event: total count and breakdown by status (submitted, reviewed, rejected).

formdata.description: File upload for fieldId 173. Repeat this key for multiple files (max 5).

request.description: Update a form submission using multipart form-data. Each field is sent as a form-data key matching the formFieldId. Text values are sent as text. File fields are sent as file parts using the same formFieldId as the key; repeat the key for multiple files (max 5 per field). Repeated text keys are joined as CSV.
Update submission status: 1=submitted, 2=reviewed, 3=rejected. Can add admin notes.
Delete a form submission. Cascades to delete all associated field values.

query.description: Filter by ward id (uses __ward_number_id field). Alias: wardNumberId.
Filter by booth id (uses __booth_number_id field). Alias: boothNumberId.
Filter by submitted by (submission user id). Alias: submittedBy.
Filter by submitted date from (YYYY-MM-DD). Alias: submittedFrom.
Filter by submitted date to (YYYY-MM-DD). Alias: submittedTo.

request.description: Get a report for a form event including summary metrics and tabular data. Metrics include totalSubmissions, totalForms, publicRegistrationForms, crfRegistrationForms, and notAssignedForms. Option fields in tabular data return labels. The first tabular header is "SL No.".
Get global form event metrics (no formEventId required). Metrics include totalSubmissions, totalForms, publicRegistrationForms, crfRegistrationForms, and notAssignedForms.

query.description: Filter by ward id (-1 or empty uses accessibility). Alias: ward_number_id.
Filter by booth id (-1 or empty uses accessibility). Alias: booth_number_id.

request.description: Get posts report (stats, last days, reactions). Enforces accessibility; out-of-scope filters return 403.

query.description: Search by business name, PAN, GSTIN, contact number, email, or address.

request.description: Get business report with category metrics and tabular data (only businesses created by the authenticated user).

query.description: Filter by ward id (-1 or empty for all).
Filter by booth id (-1 or empty for all).

request.description: Get public events report with metrics and tabular registration data. Event filter is mandatory.
Public events metrics (no eventId required). Metrics include totalEvents, registeredUsers, upcomingEvents, eventsThisMonth, and eventsThisWeek.

request.description: Updates mutable fields on an application. Status/audit columns remain server managed. Attach a new document to replace the existing file.
Soft deletes the application (status=0).

Send notification to users matching specific ward/booth access combinations and role. `roleId` is required. `accesses` is optional; if omitted or empty, the sender's access list (wardNumberId/boothNumberId) is used. When `accesses` is provided, it must be within the sender's access scope; out-of-scope values are rejected. Use -1 in the body to target all within the sender's access. Single notification log entry created with all combinations stored.
Get detailed information about a targeted notification including targeting criteria, delivery statistics, and recipient list.
